Consideration 1: Finding the meaning of digital tools in a lesson

It is fruitful to view digital pedagogy as a series of separate tasks that involve different levels of interaction with one or more digital tools.

At the core of digital pedagogy is its ability to encompass the bigger picture: the ultimate objectives are always consistent with the tasks and assessments at hand.

Tip: During a lesson, digital actions may vary from watching a video, taking notes, searching for information, playing a game, working on a shared document, or attending an online distance lesson.

A single task in a digital tool may be a crucial part of the whole structure of learning.

Not everything needs to be digital in digital pedagogy.
